name: Physical intrusion of hardware storage space
description: Intruder gains access to area within which repository technical hardware is physically located.
notes:
- Are vulnerabilities conceivably evident within repository's physical security?
- Is it possible that individuals internal or external to the repository might be motivated to compromise system security to acquire or vandalise materials? 

The full description of this risk has been obtained from examples provided in DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment, March 2007, Digital Curation Centre (DCC) and Digital Preservation Europe (DPE), http://www.repositoryaudit.eu/
preMitigationNotes: - Intruder breaks into repository, bypassing security measures
mitigationStrategy:
Avoidance strategies:
- Establish, test and regularly evaluate policies and procedures for physical security in accordance with relevant standards
identifiedBy: DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment
